newsitem.title: JAPAN: NTT seeks approval for unit to start int'l service.
newsitem.headline: NTT seeks approval for unit to start int'l service.

text.p: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp said on Wednesday that it had applied for government approval for a wholly-owned subsidiary NTT Worldwide Telecommunications Corp to start international call services.
The new firm, which is expected to begin services to corporate clients in the autumn, will be capitalised at 6.3 billion yen, NTT said in a statement.
The international call carrier will initially offer services connecting Japan and countries such as the United States, Britain, France, Germany, Hong Kong and Singapore, the statement said.
A company official said NTT Worldwide Telecommunications expects annual sales of at least five billion yen in 2000/01.
